pros: Flexible hours, freedom of creativity
cons: Needs updated equipment in the Picket Room

review_title: Students both traditional and non-traditional make it all worth it
job_title: Coordinator of Disability Support Services in Shepherdstown, WV
pros: There are valiant collaboration efforts when other departments get the opportunity to learn who you are but you must do the leg work and show them. It’s a small institution, so be ready to give your all and your best at all times-my favorite part was this is honestly a place of important impact if you work in a student oriented department
cons: Some coworkers-colleagues don’t understand that university is still a place of learning and at the end of the day, it’s not a competition, it’s a place for collaboration and support for the students.

job_title: Head Volleyball Coach in Shepherdstown, WV
pros: Great campus to recruit to.
cons: The budget and salary are very low.

pros: Its a paycheck, and tuition benefits
cons: Toxic, there is no life in the employees, everyone is on autopilot.

pros: Great facilities, super location, great university.

pros: Great job where you get experience working but also get to do your homework

pros: Beautiful Shepherstown WV! Wild and Wonderful!

job_title: Coordinator of Disability Support Services in Shepherdstown, WV
pros: Once you develop healthy professional relationships with coworkers, they do become like family. Willing to help and collaborate. Students are overall exceptional and you get inspired to support and educate them.
cons: Still a heavy culture “good ol boys” club mindset. Racial biased are easily seen and experienced. Challenging to navigate the old regime when new in management

job_title: Accounts Payable Manager in Martinsburg, WV
pros: Benefits, Vacation Time, 401K 6% Match
cons: Limitations because working for a state agency

review_title: Loved my time here, but was ready to move on...
pros: room for growth, dynamic position with lots of travel, good insurance and benefits, represent a wonderful University where people are dedicated to doing their jobs well
cons: very very low pay, almost impossible to make a living if you have loans

job_title: Senior Grant Manager in Martinsburg, WV
pros: Great people. Beautiful campus. Great benefits.
cons: Severely under funded as a state school.

pros: Nice part of the country, some brilliant colleagues, nice hours and okay benefits. Long winter breaks, really only work 8 months a year.
cons: Arrogant bullying management...antiquated student center, lots of politics, meetings on top of meetings, micromanagement, pitiful salary, minimal raises, very little emphasis on teaching, this university is more interested in research, which isn't a bad thing, but it is when the professors can't teach. Limited parking, must pay for parking, difficult to be reimbursed for anything, does not pay for the education of faculty that they require.

job_title: Residence Hall Director in Shepherdstown, WV
pros: Some of the pros that come along with working at Shepherd is the Shepherdstown community.
cons: The downside to working at Shepherd Iniversity is that there are too many people who say they want change but aren't open to change when it's presented. Shepherd is more of a stepping stone than a place to settle down for a career.

pros: Nice benefits package, ample parking for employees, not a lot of traffic for a college town, polite students.
cons: Horrible supervisors, embarrassing pay, very petty rivalry between departments, out of date technology, complicated academic procedures, depressing and dull lifestyle for students.

job_title: Building and Events Coordinator in Shepherdstown, WV
pros: Easy job, ability to meet many people, ability to do homework and projects while working. Flexible hours.
cons: Keeping of the keys, some other employees would accidentally take keys with them and leave me unable to lock or unlock the building and various rooms.

job_title: Program Assistant I in Shepherdstown, WV
pros: Professional Development, education, work environment, knowledgeable management, growth opportunities
cons: Location is inconvenient for young professionals.  Salaries state mandated despite location with highest cost of living in the state

pros: You get to know everyone and it feels very close-knit. The University library is a particularly nice place to work.
cons: They don't pay that much, and there's always something going on at the university that the administration refuses to address or fix.
